keyword: how many calories are in a fried egg
title: How Many Calories Are in a Fried Egg?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in a fried egg, including full nutrition breakdown, protein, fat, carbs, and simple tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories Are in a Fried Egg?
assumptions: Large egg (~50 g), fried in 1 tsp oil or butter, sunny-side up, minimal added salt.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, frying method, added fats, and seasonings. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One large fried egg contains about 92 kcal and 6.3 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Fried in 1 tsp butter instead of oil
Add 1 slice of cheese on top

faqs.q: How many calories are in a fried egg?
faqs.a: About 92 kcal for one large fried egg.

faqs.q: Is a fried egg higher in calories than boiled?
faqs.a: Yes, due to added cooking fat; fried is ~92 kcal vs. ~78 kcal boiled.

faqs.q: What is the protein in a fried egg?
faqs.a: Approximately 6.3 g protein per large fried egg.

faqs.q: Does frying method affect calories in a fried egg?
faqs.a: Yes, more oil or butter increases calories; minimal fat keeps it around 92 kcal.

faqs.q: How much fat is in a fried egg?
faqs.a: About 7 g total fat, including 2 g saturated fat per large egg.
